intro: Laurentia bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored laurentia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are typically green on the upper surface and white or silver on the underside. Its small, white flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom in late spring to early summer. Laurentia bicolor thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
